text: Jack Angel (October 24, 1930 - October 18, 2021) was an American actor, voice artist, and comedian. He was known for his many voice roles in children's shows and movies. He provided "Rocky Gibraltar" in the Toy Story and Toy Story 2 and Chunk in Toy Story 3. ==Career== He provided additional voices for Scooby-Doo and Scrappy-Doo, The Dukes, Snorks, Dino-Riders, The Smurfs, Asterix and the Big Fight, The Little Mermaid, DuckTales the Movie: Treasure of the Lost Lamp, Land of Enchantment, Super Dave: Daredevil for Hire, Aladdin, The Hunchback of Notre Dame, Hercules, Mulan, The Iron Giant, Monsters, Inc., Lilo & Stitch, Treasure Planet, Avatar: The Last Airbender, Gothic 3, Horton Hears a Who, Cars Toons: Mater's Tall Tales, The Darkness II, The Lorax, Monsters University and Despicable Me 2. ==Early life== Angel was born and raised in Modesto, California on October 24, 1930. ==Personal life== Angel has been married twice. He was first married to Barbara Angel and they divorced in 1980.Angel, Jack 1930- | Encyclopedia.com In 1984 he married his second wife, talent agent and agency owner Arlene Thornton. The couple has three children. They lived in Studio City, California and Malibu, California. Angel died at his Malibu home on October 18, 2021 at the age of 90. ==Filmography== ===Animated films=== Year Title Role Notes 1986 The Transformers: The Movie Ramjet, Astrotrain 1986 Voltron: Fleet of Doom King Zarkon, Cmdr.
